result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry A. Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety with the exception of any prescription medications.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no contact with C.W. (Agent may place further restrictions at his/her discretion).
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

ADDRESS INFO for Jerry A. Williams

Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jerry A. Williams
Current: 8112 Village Drive, Whitelaw, WI 54247 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Status conference on August 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerry A. Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael C Griesbach appeared by video for Jerry A. Williams. 
Attorney Griesbach argues the defense motion to modify bond, as detailed in his written motion filed in the case on 05-20-2022.  Also adding that the defendant has confirmed that upon his release he would be able to stay with a friend at 2928 S 10th Street Manitowoc, WI.
The State and the victim object to any modification of bond, for the same reasons provided at all previous bond hearings.  
Court modifies bond to $10,000.00 recognizance with the conditions as follows: 

Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs, except any prescribed medications.
Defendant is to have no contact with C.E.W. DOB: 05-22-1995, any premises she may occupy, or with 1201 New York Ave Manitowoc, WI - unless otherwise allowed within pending family/civil matters.
Defendant must comply with all orders contained in 22FA36.
Upon release, the defendant is required to reside at 2928 S 10th street Manitowoc, WI.
Defendant is to have no contact with the residence at 830 N 12th street, Manitowoc, WI.

Attorney Griesbach to draft order.
Statement of Lisa Temme.
Motion to Modify Bail.
Motion hearing on May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant to Judge Dewane re: cash bail.
Scheduling conference on July 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion. 
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond is denied.
Letter from defendant to Judge Dewane.

Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerry A. Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael C Griesbach appeared by video for Jerry A. Williams. 
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL  - 
Court finds that victim rights have been complied with.  
Attorney Griesbach argues the defendant's motion to modify bail based upon the written submission filed 04-19-2022.  The defendant has confirmed with a friend that he could live with her if released.  Defendant also makes statement on this motion. 
State objects to any modification of bond as the amount has already been reduced once.   The victim also has expressed to the State that she is opposed to the bail being modified.  
Court denies the motion.  State to draft order.
Motion hearing on April 21, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Letter from defendant to Judge Dewane.

Order granting defendant's motion to modify bail.
The Court, for the reasons stated on the record on March 16, 2022, hereby reduces the cash bond to $1,500.00.   All other conditions of bail shall remain the same.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping, intimidate witness, criminal damage to property-dvo, disorderly conduct -dvo, resist officer, possess THC with intent to deliver, possess schedule IV drug, possess uncontrolled prescription drug and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-07-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $20,500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with C.E.W., DOB: 05-22-1995 or 1201A New York Avenue, Manitowoc, WI or anyone else that resides at the New York Avenue address and no contact with any premises C.E.W. occupies and no contact with the residence at 830 N. 12th Street, Manitowoc, WI and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.    Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
